name: Netlify
help: Netlify’s command line interface (CLI) lets you configure continuous deployment straight from the command line. You can use Netlify CLI to run a local development server that you can share with others, run a local build and plugins, and deploy your site.

properties.name: Directory
properties.help: Specify a folder to deploy.

properties.name: Functions
properties.help: Specify a functions folder to deploy.

properties.name: Production
properties.help: Deploy to production.

properties.name: ProductionIfUnlocked
properties.help: Deploy to production if unlocked, create a draft otherwise.

properties.name: Alias
properties.help: Specifies the alias for deployment, the string at the beginning of the deploy subdomain. Useful for creating predictable deployment URLs. Avoid setting an alias string to the same value as a deployed branch. alias doesn’t create a branch deploy and can’t be used in conjunction with the branch subdomain feature. Maximum 37 characters.

properties.name: Branch
properties.help: Serves the same functionality as --alias. Deprecated and will be removed in future versions.

properties.name: Open
properties.help: Open site after deploy.

properties.name: Message
properties.help: A short message to include in the deploy log.

properties.name: Auth
properties.help: Netlify auth token to deploy with.

properties.name: Site
properties.help: Netlify auth token to deploy with.

properties.name: Json
properties.help: Output deployment data as JSON.

properties.name: Timeout
properties.help: Timeout to wait for deployment to finish.

properties.name: Trigger
properties.help: Trigger a new build of your site on Netlify without uploading local files.

properties.name: Build
properties.help: Run build command before deploying.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: Name of site.

properties.name: AccountSlug
properties.help: Account slug to create the site under.

properties.name: WithCI
properties.help: Initialize CI hooks during site creation.

properties.name: Manual
properties.help: Force manual CI setup. Used --with-ci flag.

properties.name: SiteId
properties.help: Site ID to delete.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: Delete without prompting (useful for CI).

commonTaskProperties.name: HttpProxy
commonTaskProperties.help: Proxy server address to route requests through.

commonTaskProperties.name: HttpProxyCertificateFileName
commonTaskProperties.help: Certificate file to use when connecting using a proxy server.
